dmca.title: Fwd: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Classmates Online, Inc.'s IP on FindLostClassmate.co
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, February 16, 2006 7:06 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Classmates Online, Inc.'s IP on
FindLostClassmate.com Website

This message was received at abuse@theplanet.com on Wednesday, February 15,
2006 at
6:25:16 PM and concerns a matter for which responsibility is delegated to
your team. The message and headers follow.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

SUBJECT:
[ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Classmates Online, Inc.'s IP on
FindLostClassmate.com Website

MESSAGE BODY:
Dear Sir or Madam:

Inre:  FindLostClassmate.com eBay Auction No. 7590825298    

We are writing in response to the attempted eBay auction of the
FindLostClassmate.com website, your unauthorized use of the CLASSMATES
registered trademark in your domain and on your site, and the unauthorized
use of Classmates Online's copyright protected material on your website's
homepage.

As you probably know, Classmates Online, Inc. ("Classmates Online") owns and
operates the popular website, www.classmates.com
<outbind://14/www.classmates.com> , the leading online community that
connects more than 40 million members with friends, family, military and
work colleagues. Classmates Online also owns the exclusive trademark rights
for CLASSMATES.COM (Reg. No. 2,584,325), and CLASSMATES (Reg.
Nos. 2,758,007 and 2,755,056) in the United States and internationally.
Classmates Online has made a substantial investment in developing and
providing its services and has acquired a tremendous amount of goodwill and
brand equity in the CLASSMATES name. As we hope you can appreciate,
Classmates Online is concerned that your unauthorized use of the CLASSMATES
registered trademark on your site and in your domain name may cause
confusion as to whether you or your company's activities are authorized,
endorsed or sponsored by Classmates Online when, in fact, they are not. 

Additionally, your website includes the following phrase "Leap through a
portal to the best of your past. Rediscover the people, places, and pop
culture of your youth" on its homepage. Classmates Online uses this phrase
extensively in its advertising and gained copyright protection for this
phrase in 2001, Copyright Reg No. TX 5-508-975. 

International and US federal laws protect against the unauthorized use,
sale, or offering for sale a domain name which infringes another's
trademark. Infringers who have been notified of such infringing activity,
but do not cease their infringements, may also be considered "willful" and
could be subject to monetary damages. Having received this e-mail, you are
on such notice. 

While we understand that you may have registered the above domain name and
developed the FindLostClassmate.com website without full knowledge of the
law in this area and Classmates Online respects your right of expression and
your desire to conduct business on the Internet, we must enforce our own
rights in order to protect our valuable and famous trademark(s). For these
reasons, and to avoid consumer confusion, Classmates Online must insist that
you cease development and sale of competing websites which incorporate the
use of the CLASSMATES registered trademark and copyrighted material and
transfer the FindLostClassmate.com domain name to Classmates Online. 

By providing you with this notice and clarifying Classmates Online's rights,
we trust that you will promptly cease your unauthorized use and that we may
each continue to pursue our businesses and interests without necessity of
legal action. 

Sincerely,
______________________________
Tara McGuane
IP and Marketing Compliance Manager
Classmates Online, Inc., A United Online Company
2001 Lind Avenue SW, Suite 500
Renton, WA 98055
T: 425.917.4777
F: 425.271.5595
TMcGuane@corp.untd.com
This transmission is intended for the sole use of the individual(s) to whom
it is addressed and may contain information that is proprietary, privileged,
attorney work product or otherwise exempt from disclosure.
Please contact the sender if this transmission is received in error and
immediately delete this message and its attachments from your system.
Unauthorized use is prohibited.

        by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from
abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com)

        by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from TMcGuane@classmates.com)
        with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id
1F9WyO-00015e-MP
        for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 15 Feb 2006 18:26:16 -0600
Received: from nat80.classmates.com ([65.197.174.94]

        by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from TMcGuane@classmates.com)
        with esmtp (Exim) id 1F9WxY-000H2z-QO
